chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus A. Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 13 days seved, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided.
** Pay DNA surcharges.  
** Pay restitution plus surcharges. - Hearing to be set.  May Not have contact with anyone who uses or traffics controlled substances.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

superMiscConds.notes: Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  May Not have contact with drug felons unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B VanCuick. Clerk/H. Barnett. On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of  4 years WSP:  2 years initial confinement w/credit for 213 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 3  the court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP concurrent to ct 1:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 213 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; civil judgment entered on any outstanding costs.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions concurrent on cts 1 & 3 and to 16CF259 & 16CF422; 1 year conditional jail is stayed; deft to pay $500 DNA surcharge; bond applied to restitution and costs, bond also applied to costs in files 16CF259 & 16CF422, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; credit for 13 days served if revoked.  No contact with anyone who uses or traffics controlled substances.  Restitution is ordered and a hearing is to be set before Commissioner Dowse.

Defendant Marcus A. Beck appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Defendant in custody. Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Atty Kraus called witness KPD Detective V. Correa; sworn in and testified; cross examination by Atty Edwards. ST rests and moves for bind over; Atty Edwards objects; arguments heard. Probable cause found, bound over for trial. Information to be filed. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
